A brief description of your dataset including its provenance, dimensions, etc. as well as the reason why you chose this dataset.
The data set contains columns related to towns, town codes, town names, population, regional information, coastal classification, job density, income, university presence, and education attainment statistics. The dataset contains 1104 rows and 31 columns.
Make sure to load the data and use inline code for some of this information.

title: A look at apprenticeship obtainment and the impact of economic factors on educationial otainment
text:
Questions
The two questions you want to answer.
For my first question will be to look at the the relationship between university presence and region on the number of 19-year-old in apprenticeships.
For my second question I want to see if there is a relationship between higher income and job density leads to higher education scores. This would suggest that economic factors play a significant role in educational attainment.
Analysis plan

For question one - I need to normalize the 19-year-old in Apprenticeships to population as we would expect that towns with a high population would have larger number of 19-year old. To normalize this I will sum all the activity at 19-years and then find the percentage of that number that are in apprenticeships. This will be our Y-axis. Our x-axis will be if their is a university present. Then I will have the regions set colors.
For question two - I will created a 3D scatter plot with the following variables. X-axis will be income, Y-axis will be job Density and the Z-axis will be Education score. I will also add color to the education score to add a heat map effect to clearing distinguish where we are seeing high educational scores.

Plan of Attack

title: Apprenticeship by Geographical Region and University Presence.
text:
Introducing our Data Set
Educational attainment of young people in English towns

The data set contains 1104 rows and 31 columns
Data set contains information related to towns, population, regional information, coastal classification, job density, income, university presence, and education attainment statistics

title: Apprenticeship by Geographical Region and University Presence.
section: Why I Chose the Data Set
text:
Why I Chose the Data Set

It was the first data set that upon reviewing I immediately though of a question
I saw that the data contained

If universities where present
How many 19 year olds were in apprenticeships

I suspected that a greater percentage would attend apprenticeships in towns where universities weren’t present

title: Apprenticeship by Geographical Region and University Presence.
text:
Question

Had two variables; university presence, 19 year olds in apprenticeships
Needed a third variable so I added in region

title: How the presence of universities and impact the number of young adults in apprenticeship.

title: Apprenticeship by Geographical Region and University Presence.
text: Creating GGplot - geom_point

title: Apprenticeship by Geographical Region and University Presence.
text:
Interpenetration of Geom_point

Looks like there is a higher percentage of 19 years in apprenticeships in town with no university
Looks like the North East and North West have higher numbers of aprrenticeships
Geom_point doesn’t tell use much about the distribution so we’ll create a box pot to see the distribution

title: Apprenticeship by Geographical Region and University Presence.
text: Creating ggplot - Boxplot

title: Apprenticeship by Geographical Region and University Presence.
text:
Interpreting the Box Plot

Looks like the North East and North West have higher median of 19-year olds in apprenticeships in towns without universities
The distributions of 19-year olds in apprenticeship is more spread out in towns with no university and more consolidated in towns with universities
The North West contains the town with the highest number fo 19-years old in apprenticeships but they are outliers. The median for the North West is behind the North East
The North East does not contain the towns with the highest percentage of 19-year olds in apprenticeships but the region has the highest median of 19 year-olds in apprenticeships for both towns with universities present and towns without universities
A lot of data clustered together wanted to create a graph that shows the same data but not so congested together

title: Apprenticeship by Geographical Region and University Presence.
text: Creating ggplot - Boxplot - Facet_Grid

title: Apprenticeship by Geographical Region and University Presence.
text:
Conclusion

North East and North West regions have higher median of 19-year olds in apprenticeships
The distribution spread of 19-year olds in apprenticeship is greater in towns with no university and more consolidated in towns with universities
The North West contains the towns with the highest precentage of 19-years olds in apprenticeships but they are outliners.
The North East region has the highest median number of 19-year olds in apprenticeships
